label: 段銭
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: A province-wide tax in cash collected on units (tan) of land. Originally, an extraordinary levy to offset certain court expenses; later, the Muromachi bakufu levied tansen on an increasingly regular basis to cover its own expenses. Shugo were later authorized to levy their own, called shugo tansen. Tansen had a strong public, official character.　[守護]
